text: A wall of identical safe deposit boxes... A black valise crammed with money... A FERRET-NOSED man, JULIO by name, the cash-filled valise into a box, flips the lid shut... box is returned to its slot... A key locks the box door..

ROBERT “BOBBY” TRENCH, aka “Bobby T,” aka “Bobby B,” aka “Bobby Beans,” (Late 30s, taciturn) studies a BULLET HOLE a Victorian marble column. A scar of long ago violence. Behind Bobby, Ferret Nose emerges from the vault. Bobby hides his face as Ferret Nose crosses behind him and exit MS. YOUNG (early 20s and perky) approaches.
Admiring our bullet hole? Billy the Kid put that there during a robbery in 1880.
How much did he get away with?
The vault was locked for the day. Sheriff did shoot two of Billy’s men on the front steps though.
Ms. Young chatters, but Bobby isn’t listening. Bobby is staring at the wall of safe deposit boxes.
Your box will be available any time from an hour after opening to 30 minutes before close. Also if you open a checking account, we'll give you 5% off the box along with free overdraft protection.
And here I was hoping for a free toaster.
Why would a bank give out toasters? Bobby’s phone RINGS.  9/15/09 2guns 2.

MARK “STIG” STIGMAN (no aka’s, a manic ball of forward leaning energy) sits looking out at the sleepy main drag Tres Cruces. Specifically at the entrance of the Tres Cru S & L where Ferret Nose climbs into a car with two other rough characters and drives off. A WAITRESS idles at Stig’s table.
I’m ordering you the french toast.
No, Ma, nothing important.
Our very patient waitress, Maggie -- at least it says Maggie on her name tag -- has poured me four cups of coffee. If I don’t order at this point, it’s just rude.
I can come back.
I’m making an executive decision. Pancakes. OUT THE WINDOW - CAMERA finds Bobby emerging from the ban striding toward the diner.
No, no pancakes. I hate pancakes.
What are you a communist? (to the Waitress) I‘1l have the hash and my friend’1l have the pancakes with a fried egg.
If she brings me eggs and pancakes, I will kick your ass.
You need to eat breakfast. It’s the most important meal of the day. DOOR CHIMES jingle as Bobby marches in.  9/15/09 2guns 3.
Ignore everything he’s said. If you'll just bring me an 0O.J., that’d be great.
Bring him coffee and toast too. As the waitress retreats, Stig gives her a big wink.
Why do you have to do that?
Do what?
Wink at the waitress. You hang her up for five minutes then give her a creepy wink like you’re gonna ask her to take a ride in your Camaro.
Hey, waitresses like me.
Nobody likes you.
I’m a likable guy. I’m a good tipper. So. The bank?
The bank. As Bobby talks we flash to IMAGES of:

Bobby surveys the bank as Ms. Young leads him back to the vault. The bank is old-fashioned in its architecture but modern in its security features. In sync with the V.O. Bo notes the cameras, position of the guard, alarm buttons,

4 tellers, 1 guard. Bulletproof glass, multiple security cameras. The manager’s office is between the tellers and the vault so we’1ll have to hope we catch him on the floor. Beyond that the safe deposit boxes are just sitting there.  9/15/09 2guns 4. INT. DINER —- CONTINUOUS FROM ABOVE

So it’s doable? Bobby nods. Stig slaps his hands on the table with glee. DOOR CHIMES. Two SHERIFF’S DEPUTIES enter. Stig and Bobby go silent and tight. Greeting the staff by name, the deputies settle in at the counter and help themselves to the display of jelly donut The waitress returns with Bobby’s O.J. and coffee for Sti
I'll be right back with your hash.
Wait. Maggie. Your jelly donuts, are they any good?
Best in three counties.
Put three in a to-go box. Two for me, one for him.
Just two. Stig flashes three fingers to the waitress as she retreat A beat. Without preamble, Stig jumps to his feet.
Gotta shake the weasel. As Stig vanishes into the back, one of the cops throws a glance Bobby’s way. Bobby gives the cop a flat look back. The waitress returns with Stig’s hash and the donuts.
I apologize for my friend. He was kicked in the head as a child.
Oh, he’s not that bad.
No. He is.  9/15/09 2guns 5. Stig returns. Without sitting, he digs out a donut.
Mmm, these are good. We should go.
Your food just got here. Stig flicks his eyes at the cops.
You didn’t?

You ever hear the saying “never rob a bank across from a diner with the best donuts in three counties?” Bobby stands and tosses cash on the table. Behind the counter SMOKE begins to curl out of the kitchen.
That’s all you’re gonna leave for a tip?
You are a complete lunatic, you know that?
You gotta leave at least 30%. The woman’s about to be out of a job. The tendrils swell becoming flames as the kitchen is engu in a roaring grease fire.
(tossing down another $10) This, this is why nobody likes you.

Bobby and Stig saunter out the door and back to their car Behind them smoke billows. Chaos. Shouts. Alarms. Patrons and wait-staff flee. A FIREBALL blows out the windows. FREEZE FRAME: Bobby & Stig in F.G.; the blazing diner in MAIN TITLE CARD: “2 GUNS”  9/15/09 2guns 6.

A private kingdom in the Sonora desert. Ancient stone wal Adobe buildings. Vaqueros on horseback work EXPANSIVE LIVESTOCK PENS. FIND Bobby and Stig speeding along. Past BARNS that house not just cattle but processing areas for cocaine and hero Past a DIRT AIRSTRIP where bales of marijuanas are being loaded onto a piper cub. Up to the MAIN HOUSE where a row barbecue is underway. Half a cow on a spit. Narco corrido on the stereo. No bling, no bimbos in mini skirts. Just hard men eating, drinking and slinging dominos. Bobby and Stig are greeted by RUDY (knife-scarred and wil Rudy shakes hands with Bobby. Stig, he ignores.
Papi’s down in the stables.
Go get something to eat.
I’m not hungry.

Stig, you and I are here to do business. Diplomatically. If closing this deal involved shooting the wings off a fly while driving on two wheels through a ring of fire, I'd be the one getting something to eat.
I can be diplomatic. A glare from Bobby. Stig goes. Reluctantly.
Bobby, toting a duffle, is lead inside and down into a network of ancient tunnels that run beneath the ranch.  9/15/09 2guns 7.

Rudy pauses at an antechamber and motions for Bobby to wa Nearby savage LAUGHTER erupts from a group of MEAN CHARAC who are taking turns peeking inside a bowling ball bag. MEAN #1 (OSCAR) holds the bag toward Bobby. Wanna see? Bobby shrugs. Oscar comes over. And with great flare snap the bag open under Bobby’s nose. We see nothing more than a wisp of hair, but the half-fli in Bobby's expression is enough to tell us there’s a huma head inside. Oscar and the others CACKLE. Returning, Rudy shoos the toughs and waves Bobby on.

location: VAULTED CHAMBER BELOW THE STABLES, GRECO RANCH

text: Seated on a wooden crate MANUEL “PAPI” GRECO (a man of ea and blood) plucks the feathers from a duck carcass. Loomi in the corner is Ferret-Nose Julio from the bank.
“T-know-a-guy” Bobby. Quick: an ostrich, a tank of ether, and a ‘55 Thunderbird.
Will you take a ‘56?
In El Paso by Wednesday?
I know a guy. Papi finds this game a chuckle. He squishes his fingers i the flesh of the duck and digs out three pellets of bucks
Not for nothing, but who’s the head in the bag?
My cousin.
Little Toro?  9/15/09 2guns 8.

Julio caught him skimming. Not that I blame Little Toro. Everybody skims a little cream, it’s human nature. But just ‘cuz it’s human, don’t mean you let it go. Papi takes a hatchet - THWACK - chops off the duck’s head PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) That for me? Bobby pulls a shiny new CHAINSAW from his duffle.
The gas-powered MS 270. Throttle trigger interlock, bumper spikes, quickstop chain-brake. Setting aside the duck, Papi comes over to examine his ne toy. Bobby sets a protective hand on the saw.
Where’s my present? Papi motions to Ferret-Nosed Julio who tosses Bobby a satchel. Inside are 200 blank passports and 400 blank soc security cards. Bobby examines them. His expression sours
These are garbage.
They’re what I got.
If I take these, I’m telling you I don't know my business, and I know my business. A sudden air of menace hangs. Papi’s boys glower.
You too good for my product?
I’m saying anyone who’d take these is stupid, desperate, or looking to put you in jail. Which one you think I am? A beat. Papi looks to his boys. Then shrugs/smirks.  9/15/09 2guns 9.
I told you he wouldn’t take ‘em.
So, what, is that it? I pass your test?

It’s not just you. After Little Toro we’re running everybody through the blender. If it soothes your ego, I’1ll give you 39,000 for the ‘56 Thunderbird. Assuming it’s mint. THWACK - Papi chops off the duck’s feet.
Four ROUGHNECKS shoot at a line of chickens buried up to their necks in the dirt. Bets are traded. A bottle is passed. Stig sits nearby finishing a plate of barbecue.
That’s not very sporting. What chance are you giving the chickens? The roughnecks trade scornful remarks in Spanish and retu to their game. Stig hurls a leg bone at them. They stop. They glare.

If I’m gonna kill a defenseless animal, I’m gonna honor its sacrifice by grilling it up into some tasty barbecue. What I’m not gonna do, is torture it just to prove I’m a crappy shot who can’t hit anything further away than his own pecker.
Rudy walks Bobby back out into the harsh Mexican sunlight They spot Stig jousting with the roughnecks.
Looks like your junkyard dog’s off the chain again. Bobby grumbles/sighs and marches over to Stig.  9/15/09 2guns 10.
What are you doing?
They're torturing those chickens. A roughneck curses at Stig in Spanish.
Say that in English, monkey boy.
Stig. Look at me. You see that bag on the buffet table? Bobby points over at the barbecue/party where the men wit the bowling ball bag have joined the others.
Between the ribs and the potato salad?
There’s a human head inside.
Aw, sonofa... That is uncool; that is not cool. The roughnecks mutter Spanish curses. Stig lunges at them Bobby grabs Stig. Stig calms.
It’s all right. I’m all right. Stig and Bobby turn to go. Behind them the roughnecks CHUCKLE. That tears it. In one seamless motion Stig whips around and shoots the heads off all five chickens.
Bobby and Stig walk back across the ranch to their car.
I hate Mexico. I hate the dust, I hate the desert, I hate the beer.
I’m sure it hates you back.
You don’t think Papi suspects?  9/15/09 2guns 11.
If Papi knew we were planning to rip him off, it’d be our heads in that bag by the potato salad.
Nah, our two heads’d never fit ina bag that small.

The colossal border jam up. Car and buses and smoke belch trucks await inspection. Lines of day laborers cross on foot, ready to work hard. If they can find work, that is. Bobby and Stig sit in their non-moving car in the non-mov line. Bobby looks into the station wagon beside them. 5 Mexican house painters with sun-creased faces look back.
Papi’s guy delivers a briefcase full of money to that bank every two weeks. At that rate he’s gotta have, what, two mil stashed there?
Math sounds right.
What happens if we get caught?
If we get caught, it’1l be your fault and I’11 kill you.
Sure, whatever, but say we do? And say Papi Greco mangles my corpse, runs it through a sawmill, something like that, would you come after him?
Nope.
You wouldn't kill him? Because if he did that to you I’d kill him.
Then you’re an idiot.  9/15/09 2guns 12.
You know why I’d kill him, because you’re my people and there’s a code.
First up: there is no code. You do what you have to do. The rest is just stuff that makes you stupid.
And second? (a look from Bobby) Right. We're not “people.” Because you, you don’t have people. Bingo. Bobby and Stig roll up to the inspection booth.
Purpose for you visit to Mexico?
Quail hunting.
My aunt in Tuba City had a heart attack so we cut our trip short. The guard considers Bobby and Stig. Considers their documents. Then retreats inside the shack.
Tuba City?
It’s near Odessa.
Nice place?

Hell hole but she is my favorite aunt. A sudden commotion. Boots. Guns. Swarming men in kevlar. Before Bobby and Stig can react their car is surrounded b armed border agents. M-1l6s leveled, fingers on triggers.
A team of border agents tear apart Bobby and Stig’s car.  9/15/09 2guns 13.
A UNIFORMED BORDER AGENT grills Stig. DEA AGENT DEB REES (driven, but not without a sense of humor) observes.
Tell Agent Rees about Papi Greco.
Who?
Papi. Greco.
He some kind of Mexican Santa Claus?
I didn’t fall off the turnip truck, Mr. Stigman and my roots aren’t blonde so how ‘bout you stop playing the stupid card?

No ma‘am. It’s my intent to cooperate with whatever you need. As an American, I know you’re just doing your job and sometimes innocent folks like me get caught up in the system. It’s like with the airlines. They didn’t lose your bag on purpose, but everybody takes it so personal. I bet you two see a lot of frowning faces. Stig winks at Deb. Deb rolls her eyes and exits.
A similar HARD-CASE BORDER AGENT grills Bobby. DEA SUPERVISING AGENT MARLON JESSUP (decent, dedicated) sits on this one.
Tell us about your trip.
Lawyer.  9/15/09 2guns 14.
What’s the big deal? You were just down in Sonora?
Lawyer.
(re: Jessup) You think Agent Jessup and the DEA don’t know about you and Papi Greco? They know you were at his ranch.
Lawyer. Hard-Case bristles. Jessup puts a hand on his shoulder an nods for Hard-Case to step out. Hard-Case goes. A beat.
Five border agents are ripping apart your car as we speak.
They’re not gonna find anything.
Where'd you hide the passports?
There are no passports.
What are you talking about? The deal was in place. A hand to hand buy from Papi Greco for 200 passports.
I turned them down. (off Jessup’s disbelief) They were third rate crap. Deb enters.
Your pal, Stig’s a piece of work.
He winked at you, didn’t he?
Bobby rejected the passports.  9/15/09 2guns 15.
Papi was testing me. If I’d taken the passports, I’d never have gotten off the ranch alive.
You sure about that?
Don’t insult me. I’ve got four years in on this. I have waded through sewage. I had a bag with a human head in it shoved under my nose, okay?
I know. I know all you’ve been through and I know how you’ve had to give your life over to playing the part of Bobby Beans.
I can get Papi Greco. TI have an angle. The only trick is I need you to let me rob the Tres Cruces Savings & Loan.
You want to rob a bank?
No. Stig wants to rob the bank. It was his idea, he approached me, no entrapment. What I want is for you to help me stop him, just not until he’s accessed the safe deposit boxes.
And just why does “Stig” want to break into the safe deposit boxes?

Because Papi Greco has two million dollars stashed there, and if we can access the money -- like if it was evidence in a failed robbery -- we can nail him for unreported tax evasion and possibly RICO.
What happens to Stig?  9/15/09 2guns 16.
He takes it hard on a class B felony, does 20 years like a good fish. Who cares?
I’m not going to like the answer, but why not just get a warrant?
We can’t. I can’t prove how I know what I know. At least not in open court.
Because how you know it is in violation of the rules of evidence?
Don’t ask / don’t tell.
No.
If it’ll get us our man...
It’s suborning felony robbery.
It’s only felony robbery if I get away with the money.
There are rules to what we do, Agent Trench. They stink and they’re awkward, but they’re the rules we've agreed to play by. Bobby scoffs/burns.
You can’t fight an avalanche with a teaspoon.
Maybe we can’t. But we’re sure gonna dig like hell.  9/15/09 2guns 17.
Bobby and Stig drive away in their reassembled car. Stig jiggles his seat.
I think my seat’s loose. You ever get flagged like that before?
Nope.
It’s like they thought we’d be holding. Which we woulda been if those passports had been any good. (a look from Bobby) I’m just saying.
Then say it. Stig reaches into his belt, pulls out a knife.

Are you playing me? ‘Cuz if I hadn’t spent the last ten months at your side, I’d think you weren’t really I-Know-A-Guy Bobby the man who can get anyone anything. I'd think you were playing me. Tension hang for a beat. Then Bobby scoffs and smiles.
Put that pig-sticker away.
(laughs ) I had you. The corner of your eye, it twitched. Just a little bit. Damn. Let’s get some tacos or something.
You gonna wink at the waitress?
Hell yeah.  9/15/09 2guns 18.
Bobby sloshes whiskey around in a plastic cup. A figure stirs in bed beside him.
That's five bucks you owe me for thinking about work.
You think Jessup knows about us?
What “us?” You don’t do “us” and I am in a relationship. Fetching a plastic wrapped cup from the bathroom, Deb pou herself a matching whiskey.
Right, your imaginary boyfriend, Harvey.
His name’s not Harvey.
Why not? Harvey’s got a great ring to it.
You don’t get to be jealous, Bobby. Not anymore. Bobby stifles a twinge but only half-way succeeds. Deb considers Bobby.
You want me to take a run at Jessup, don’t you?
The bank will get us Papi Greco.
And in the end that’s all that matters to you?
It’s not like I got a bunch of hobbies. The job’s what I’ve got. It’s the elephant I carry.  9/15/09 2guns 19.
(resigned/disappointed) All right, I’1l talk to him. But if he still says no... Bobby gives her a kiss on the head. Then swills the rest his cup and starts to dress.
Did you ever really love me?
Of course, I did.
Ask a silly question...
I meant to love you. The room’s paid up for another 3 hours.

You always take me to the classiest joints. INT. BOBBY’S TOWNHOUSE - NIGHT A bland unit in a bland development. Bobby enters. Silenc lonely and hollow, hangs. Tossing his keys and gun on the table, Bobby goes into the BEDROOM and -- WHAP - a PHONE BOOK smacks Bobby. Bobby thuds to the floo Papi Greco steps over Bobby. With Papi are Rudy and Ferre Nose Julio.

I miss old fashion phone books. Policeman's best friend, right? But then you’d know. Because you are an undercover agent of the DEA. Rudy and Julio hoist Bobby up. Papi slams the phone book into Bobby’s gut. Bobby groan/gasp/moans. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) If you feel it’s your duty to give me a couple denials, I’1l respect that. I’m not gonna believe you and Rudy’s just gonna kick you upside the head, but feel free.  9/15/09 2guns 20.
No. No, you got me. I’m a cop. And you’re all under arrest. WHAP - phone book shot to the temple.

I should kill you. But killing a federal agent draws a whole rain of crap. So instead, I was thinking: what do you figure might happen if a hundred thousand unexplained dollars materialized in your checking account? Bobby sees where Papi’s going. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) The only thing DEA hates more than drug dealers is crooked agents. But then 4 years deep cover, you were bound to go bad.
Who burned me?
It was Saint Peter and Virgin Mary. You think I’m gonna tell you? I. Am not. An asshole. Papi stomps Bobby’s chest. Bobby gasps/yowls/moans.
Your mother’s a one legged whore.

You trying to get me to shoot you? Bobby. It’s too much fun watching you squirm. Besides, truth is she was a whore. Two legs though. Enjoy prison. I hear they do entertaining things to dirty cops. Papi tosses aside the phone book and exits. Delivering fi kicks to the gut, Rudy and Ferret-Nose Julio follow.
Bobby scuttles in. Inserts his card into the ATM. His balance flashes “$108,763.31” Bobby slams the machine. Th kid behind the counter glares.  9/15/09 2guns 21.

location: BULLPEN, EL PASO BRANCH OF THE DEA

text: Deb works at her desk. Bobby hurries in.
I need you to come with me.
I haven’t had a chance to brace Jessup. ACROSS THE BULLPEN - Jessup calls out from his office.
Bobby. If you’ll come in my office for a minute.
One sec. (pulling Deb’s arm) Come on, let’s go, we gotta get out of here.
What’s wrong?
Now, Bobby. Please. A beat. No real option, Bobby reluctantly comes. INT. JESSUP’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS
Sit down. Bobby reads Jessup’s face. He notes the bank records layi on Jessup’s desk. Jessup knows.
Papi Greco planted the money in my account.
Sit down.
He knows I’m close to nailing him.
It doesn’t matter.  9/15/09 2guns 22. Beat. Bobby’s screwed.
This is... I ama lot of things but I am not on the take.
Then the truth will bear that out. Pending an investigation, you are as of now on unpaid administrative leave. I’m sorry.
What are you gonna do?
I don’t know. I’m... You know I'd never...
I know.
(a beat then) I’‘ll rob the Tres Cruces.
Bobby...
The bank gives us Papi Greco. When Papi falls, one of his boys’1l flip, testify the money was planted in my account.
Or we could wait for the investigation to run its course.
The bosses already think I’m guilty. They’ll shuffle papers for six months then wipe their hands.
And just when were you thinking of committing this act of lunacy?
What are you doing for lunch?  9/15/09 2guns 23.
You are completely hamstringing me on this.

I’m protecting you by giving you no other option. INT. STIG’S APARTMENT - DAY A highly unfinished loft in a rundown building. The space chopped up by dividers with windows along one whole wall. Stig lounges on a Goodwill sofa eating fistfuls of Fruit Loops and blowing shit up on X-box. 0.8. a fist POUNDS at the door. It’s Bobby.
Let’s hit the bank.
The ornate wall clock shows 12:55. The customers and tell go about their business oblivious to the impending storm.
Bobby checks his guns. Stig holds up two Halloween masks: evil clown and Frankenstein.
Who you want, clown or Frankie?
Frankie.
You saying I’m a clown?
I don’t care.
I'm kidding. You can have Frankie. Bobby considers Stig. An IMAGE flashes in Bobby’s mind:

BOBBY’S IMAGINATION - Bobby and Stig rush out of the bank right into the teeth of a DEA ambush.  9/15/09 2guns 24. Stig looks over at Bobby. Realizes Bobby has betrayed him Stig drops the money, levels his gun at Bobby... Only to cut down by a hail of DEA bullets.
You good?
Yeah.
Not gonna back out on me?
No. Bobby and Stig pull on their masks and kick open the door
Business continues undisturbed as OUTSIDE THE WINDOW two in masks climb out of a van...
Bobby and Stig stride down the street... And right on pas the bank...
OFFICER DAVE (the native American desk officer) chats wit OFFICER PHIL (paunchy ex-marine).
«+-SO what’d you do with the Remington 22?
I traded it to my cousin for an espresso machine.
You need special beans for that? Bobby and Stig blow in, guns levelled.
If you gentlemen will refrain from reaching for your firearms.  9/15/09 2guns 25.
How many other people in the building?
Just Naomi and the Chief.
Why’d you tell ‘em that? The CHIEF steps out of the back office nose in a magazine Stig grabs him, slams him to the floor.
Easy.
What the heck is this?
It’s a bank robbery. Only instead of robbing the bank then letting you chase us, we figured we’d come get you first. NAOMI (the office assistant) enters. The coffee cup drops from her hand. Shatters.
You must be Naomi.

location: HOLDING CELLS, TRES CRUCES POLICE STATION

text: Stig and Bobby lock the cops in a cell.
Think we should leave them some water?
Anybody thirsty? (no hands) They’re fine.
They’re gonna be in there a while. Bobby sighs. Marches out. Then marches back in with a fla of water bottles which he drops by the cell door.
Can we go?  9/15/09 2guns 26.
Bobby and Stig storm the bank. Bobby pins the guard, take his sidearm. Stig spidermans over the bullet proof glass corrals the tellers.
Ladies behind the counter, keep your hands visible and off the alarms.
It’s all right, girls. Just give them the drawer cash.
(gun to the manager’s nose) Did we ask for the drawer cash? Stig spots the guard inching a hand toward an ankle holst
Guard. Bobby seamlessly whirls, kicks away the guard’s backup pi
We are being polite about this. Sit tight. It’ll be over soon. Bobby tosses his backpack to Stig. Stig grabs the manager ushers him back to the LOCKED VAULT GATE.
Open the gate.
I don’t have the key. Stig rips open the manager’s shirt revealing a key on a lanyard. Dragging the manager by the lanyard, Stig unlock the gate then deposits the manager on his butt.
Sit fido. UP FRONT - Bobby notes a quivering FEMALE CUSTOMER. She i near tears. He leans down and whispers to her.
Just pretend you’re not here. Bobby’s empathy only makes the woman cry harder.  9/15/09 2guns 27.
Sing a song. “Row, row, row your boat”? Go ahead. Row, row, row your boat...
Row, row, row your boat / gently down the stream...

Everybody. “Encouraged” by Bobby’s gun, the bank patrons join togeth in a shaky rendition of “Row, Row, Row Your Boat.” BACK IN THE VAULT - Stig hangs a net strung with magnetic charges across the wall of safe deposit boxes. Stig arms the detonator. The magnets activate attaching themselves the doors of the boxes. Stig retreats outside the vault.

Fire in the hole! BOOM! Smoke billows. Stig rushes back into the vault. The box doors are all blown off their hinges. Stig pulls out boxes. Both contain money-stuffed attache cases. Stig opens two more boxes. They also contain money-stuffe cases. As do the next two. And the next two. And the two after that.
Uh, Frankie? Bobby edges back toward the vault. Sees Stig surrounded b cash-crammed attache cases.
They’re all filled with money.
I thought Papi only had two safe deposit boxes.
I got 18 and counting.
(grabbing the manager) Whose money is this?
I, I, I, please--  9/15/09 2guns 28.

Forget it. We take the money. Figure it out later. Stig grabs a stack of bank satchels and starts loading. Bobby returns to the MAIN ROOM. Out of Stig’s earshot he sidles up to the prostrate Security Guard.
Listen to me. When we leave, there’s gonna be police gunfire. When it hits, get everyone behind the counter. The guard nods, albeit warily. Stig emerges from the vaul toting five sacks of money.
There are four more in the vault. Bobby hesitates, then goes to the vault, grabs the remain money. Together he and Stig march toward the front doors.
BOBBY’S IMAGINATION - The image of Stig getting riddled b DEA gunfire plays over and over in Bobby’s mind...
Bobby slows allowing Stig to drift ahead of him. Stig ban out the doors and...
..-Nothing. The street is quiet. No ambush. No cops. No DEA. Bobby is stunned to say the least.
Come on. Bobby, not knowing what else to do, follows Stig back to van. They heave the money in back and roar off.

location: HIGHWAY OUT OF TOWN / INT. VAN

text: Stig drives. Bobby reels. He just robbed a bank. Up ahead a two car caravan zooms at them. As the cars pass, Bobby spots Deb in the lead car with 4 WINDBREAKER CLAD DEA AGE  9/15/09 2guns 29. Bobby peers into his side mirror. The DEA caravan keeps right on going. Getting smaller and smaller.... INT. DEB'S CAR -— SAME
Is this as fast as you can go? Go.
The DEA cars roll up on the bank. Deb sees the milling crowd, realizes they are too late to stop anything.
Keep going. (when the driver hesitates) You want the world knowing one of our guys just robbed a bank? Go. The DEA cars roll past the bank and off down the street.
Nothing but arroyos and scrub brush. Bobby and Stig peer into the van at the massive pile of money and attache cas Their expressions are of concern rather than joy.
We couldn’t just be the luckiest chumps on the face of the earth?
You feel lucky?
How much you think is there?
Packs of hundreds, 60 packets per case. 70, 80 million? Stig punches the van. Walks away. Kicks the dirt.

I thought it was drug money. I thought it belonged to Papi Greco.
And who gave you that idea?
Stig, Mark Stigman. He set me up then he shot me.
And the money?
I don’t know.
So no idea? Nothing at all? Or if pressed, might you suddenly find inspiration as to where to look?
Sure.  9/15/09 2guns 59.

You know what you are? You’re a dirty DEA agent who robbed a bank and murdered your boss. You walk into any police station, any federal office, that’s the story they’re gonna have. Unless... you bring me 81.53 million dollars. Earl pulls out a sharpie. Writes 81.53 on Bobby’s arm.

81.53 million and he’s a suicide. 81.53 and you walk away clean. Have I properly incentivized you? Then get after it. Go on. Bobby staggers to his feet. Earl tucks his card in Bobby’ pocket. Bobby looks back at Jessup’s body.

If you’re thinking he deserved better, you’re right. EXT. JESSUP’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Bobby hustles back to his car. A beat. He punches the steering wheel, the roof, the seats. His rage ebbs. He's still fucked. He throws the car in gear and drives off.
A 7-series BMW sits parked in front of an expansive but n gaudy home. Beside the BMW, smoking a cigarette, is Ferre Nose Julio. A hand taps Julio on the shoulder.

Hola. Bobby pistol whips Ferret-Nose Julio. Julio drops like a of rocks as his cigarette goes spinning through the air.. INT. CHILD’S ROOM, NICE HOUSE - NIGHT CESAR (age 7) sits in bed cradling a jackknife. His fathe Papi Greco, opens the knife and shows him how to hold it.  9/15/09 2guns 60.
Hold it firm but not tight. A knife is a tool. You treat it with respect. Cesar’s mother, DAISI (sensuous and lovely) watches from door. Tucking Cesar in, Papi crosses to her.
He misses you.

And I miss you. But you're safer in El Paso than Juarez where half the police are owned by my enemies. Papi gives her a heartfelt kiss and a cash roll. EXT. DAISI’S NICE HOUSE - NIGHT Bobby hogties Julio, stows him in the bushes. Climbing behind the wheel of Papi’s car, Bobby hunkers low and wai IN THE REFLECTION IN THE SIDE MIRROR - Bobby watches Rudy Papi emerge from the house.

Let's get moving, Julio. I want to be back across the border by dawn. Bobby fingers his pistol as Papi’s hand reaches to open t car door... Suddenly out of nowhere. An ENGINE. HEADLIGHTS. Rudy and Papi whirl as a car barrels up on to the lawn. Plows into Rudy. Rudy is tossed into the shrubs. Stig leaps out of the car. Snatches Papi. Smacks his head on the roof. Slings him into the trunk. Bobby jumps from the BMW, levels his gun. Stig whirls--
Jesus, you scared me.
What are you doing?
Kidnapping Papi Greco.  9/15/09 2guns 61.
Gimme your keys.
Why, you afraid what he’s gonna tell me?
No. It’s just I got my own questions for Papi Greco and I got here first.
You can have him when I’m done.
The gun says I don’t wait in line. Stig drops the keys down the front of his pants.
Come and get ‘em. POP - Bobby socks Stig in the nose with his gun butt. Sti staggers back.
That was uncalled for. Bobby aims his pistol at Stig’s crotch.
I’m aiming for the left one, but even at this range I might clip both. Stig gives. With a shimmy/shake his leg he maneuvers the keys down his pantleg onto his shoe top.
You know, I liked you better when you were I-Know-A-Guy Bobby. That Bobby was a good guy. I trusted that Bobby.

Yeah, well, I liked you better when you were a two-bit thief with a chip on your shoulder. Stig kicks the keys high in the air and surges at Bobby. BLAM - Bobby fires a shot into the pavement between Stig’ legs. Stig freezes.  9/15/09 2guns 62.
Saw that move coming?
Yup.

So what now? One of us is gonna have to pick up the keys. A beat. 0O.S. From inside the trunk, Papi Greco thumps an curses. Still neither makes the first move. Across the lawn, Rudy pulls himself up onto one elbow and fires his Uzi. Bullets spray. Stig and Bobby dive. As Bobby returns fire, Stig grabs the keys, jumps in the and speeds off. Bobby curses, jumps in the BMW, and chase

Bobby speeds down the road, his headlights blaring in Sti rear view. Sliding up tight, he whacks Stig’s bumper. Sti ignores the hit and floors it through traffic. Bobby stay right on him. They bang, they bump, they bash. Bobby pulls alongside Stig and aims his gun out the windo Stig’s head. Stig stomps the brakes and swerves/spins acr the median, across oncoming traffic, and off down a dirt access road. Bobby throws the BMW into a power slide, gets clipped by oncoming traffic, but keeps right on after Stig. Gravel sprays as Bobby chases Stig away from the highway, away from the lights, down smaller and smaller roads. Stig flips a U-turn and takes off cross-country through t cottonwood. Bobby tracks after him. Deeper and deeper out into nowhere. Amid the dust all Bobby can see is the red of Stig’s tail lights. He is driving blind. Trees flash out of blackness He swerves and dodges. He will not give up the chase. Stig cuts left around a stand of scrub pine. Bobby cuts right. The cars separate, then pivot and charge at each other. It’s a game of chicken. Lights rush at lights. The are about to smash head on when --  9/15/09 2guns 63. Both men veer at the last moment. Stig goes nose first in a ditch. Bobby goes head on into a cactus. The two men tumble from their cars. Bobby throws a haymaker at Stig. Stig slips the punch. Bo men tumble to the dirt. A beat. There they sit in the dus glow of their headlights. Gassed. A beat. Stig laughs.
Come on, that was kinda fun. Almost despite himself, Bobby lets a half-smile slip out.
You’re insane.

You’re lucky. They’ve got me killing my boss.

So we're both innocent? Innocent and completely screwed?
Unless you can prove you were under orders when you robbed the bank.
Nope. You?

That’s hard core. They both chuckle. Bonded by their communal fucked-ness.
So what'd you want with our boy in the trunk?  9/15/09 2guns 64.
You said he set you up to look dirty. I figured I’d check your story, see if I could really trust you. You?
Somebody tipped him I was DEA. I thought if I could get him to tell me, I could slip the noose, track down the money, escape. Stig grabs the keys from his car and flips them to Bobby.
Well, I guess you better ask him.
When this is over, I’m still gonna shoot you.
Do you really think that’s gonna make you feel better?
Yeah, I do. Bobby pops the trunk. Twisted up inside, Papi Greco is ca with spittle and vomit.
Did he puke? I think he puked.
It was a bouncy ride. (to Papi) Who told you I was DEA?
Was it the Admiral?
Sure, it was the Admiral, fuck you both.
I don’t think it was the Admiral.
This might take a while. Bobby slams the trunk.  9/15/09 2guns 65.
Bobby pulls a makeshift blindfold off Papi’s head. Papi i bound to a lawn chair with extension cords.
How do you want to do this?
We could waterboard him?
Don’t we need like equipment?
Just a couple buckets and some plastic wrap.
You won't do it. The United States Government doesn’t torture.
Yeah, well, I’m persona non grata with the government, so I don’t feel particularly compelled to follow their rules.

I hope you like the taste of balls, ‘cuz I’m gonna cut yours off, stuff ‘em in your mouths. Or maybe I'11l put yours in his and his in yours.

The Tres Cruces? You robbed the Tres Cruces?
We thought we were robbing you.  9/15/09 2guns 66. Papi burst out laughing. He howls.

You're dead, you’re both dead and I don’t even have to kill you. Glee was not the reaction Bobby and Stig expected. Bobby slaps Papi. But even that fails to dampen Papi’s mood. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) How much you get?
(a look to Stig, he lies) Two million.
I thought you were sharp. Mr. Bobby Beans. But you, you ripped off the CIA.

What money? The only money I ship to that bank are my payments. Stig and Bobby trade a confused look. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) What?

You don’t know? The CIA, they skim off 7% of my revenue. In return they “let” me fly my shit across the border -- not that I was having any problems with that. They take a piece from all the cartels. It’s goddamn imperialism.  9/15/09 2guns 67.

Okay, I’m lying. I’ma liar. They’re still gonna kill you. The garage door KA-CLUNKS. Bobby and Stig whirl guns leve as scrolls upward revealing DEB’S CAR.
Bobby? INT. DEB’S KITCHEN - NIGHT Bobby placates Deb while Stig pokes through the fridge.

The Admiral is at the podium giving a power point presentation to 500 military/government types.

Outdated force-projection paradigms must be abandoned if the Navy is to embrace the new reality of asymmetrical combat. We must shake off the rust and refocus on those areas where non-state actors and criminal enterprise intersect: Somali pirates, weapons smugglers, narcotraffickers. Slide. The Admiral strides outside. Mini and 4 other SEALs (LUCA KELVIN, SANGER, and GOMEZ) wait by an SUV. Laid out in ba is Teemo, a field dressing on his leg.
Has Chief Quince reported in?
Still out hunting.
What he hunts, he finds. So be ready. How’s Teemo?
Bullet missed the femoral artery but... The Admiral checks Teemo’s leg. It’s not good.
You hanging in there?
I was thinking, sir, maybe Mini could take me to the base hospital, say it was a training accident?  9/15/09 2guns 69.
You know procedure. The boys would be tied up with questions for days. We have to settle things with Stigman and the cut-out first.
Right. Of course. I’m sorry.
You need anything more for the pain?
No, sir. I’m strong.
You have my admiration and my respect. Teemo beams. The Admiral’s respect is better than morphin The Admiral’s phone RINGS. He steps away to answer it.
EXT. BACK YARD, DEB’S HOUSE - NIGHT Stig huddles out of Bobby and Deb’s sight.
It’‘ll take you 6 minutes to trace this call. I'll be off in 3 so don’t bother.

(a beat, then the truth) Off the books money earned from drug dealers.

I am charged with protecting the people of this nation. And what the people want is to lay safe in their beds untroubled by the moral compromises required to achieve that safety. If I thought you understood... Bobby appears behind Stig.
Who are you talking to?  9/15/09 2guns 71.

(snatching Stig’s phone) Give me that. (to the Admiral on phone) Give me one reason I shouldn’t go to the CIA, tell them you’re behind this whole thing?
Because they’1l kill you anyway. Whereas I’m going to give you what you really want, a chance to clear your name.

You work in the field, Agent Trench. You understand the difference between what looks black and white on paper and the reality of getting things done. I know the frustration you carry: the DEA asking you to fight the wolves on their own turf, then making you do it in handcuffs. The Admiral's got Bobby down. Not that Bobby would admit
You're making me misty.

I'll see that Petty Officer Stigman takes the full fall for the robbery, and I‘ll guarantee you protection from the CIA. All have to do is give me your location. My men will take care of the rest. Bobby considers Stig who has no idea of the Admiral offer
Throw in a million dollars and you've got a deal.
Done.  9/15/09 2guns
Two million.

Three.

Go check on Papi.

Fine, but I’m driving. (when Bobby balks) Hey, you brought us here and see how well that turned out. Bobby gives. They pile in, Stig at the wheel, and speed o  9/15/09 2guns 75. EXT. MAMA MAYBELLE’S DINER - EARLY MORNING An old school dive. Stig pulls into the lot.

Getting breakfast. They make a dynamite omelet, and their pancakes aren’t bad either. INT. MAMA MAYBELLE’S DINER —- EARLY MORNING Bobby, Deb, and Stig huddle at a back booth. Aside from a few long-haul truckers they have the place to themselves.

We'll take three coffees and a couple of minutes. Shauna retreats.

She asked a question. Shauna returns with the coffees. Stig gives her a respect nod as she retreats once more.

Tim Corrales. His mother owns the place.

He’s dead. Okay? We served in SEAL Team Six together. He died on a mission that never happened in a country we were never in. His family was told it was a car crash. (beat) The Admiral lied and said the two million from the Tres Cruces would go to his mother and the families of the other men we lost. Marcus, how dare you sit down in my restaurant without giving me a hug first? INT. KITCHEN, MAMA MAYBELLE’S DINER - LATER Stig flamboyantly works the flattop under Mama’s iron fis supervision. Bobby and Deb watch from stools at the count

You know by all rights I should walk away and let you drown?
And validate my cynical world view? No chance.  9/15/09 2guns 78. Bobby wins a smile. He likes that smile.
You know, if I was the suave type, I’d take your hand, tell you to ditch Harvey. Run away with me to a grass hut in the South Seas.

Maybe I’m not. And indeed maybe he isn’t. OVER AT THE FLATTOP - Stig watches Bobby and Deb. The way she touches his arm, the way he leans in to her. Deb rise heads for the door. EXT. GAS STATION ACROSS THE HIGHWAY — DAY Deb approaches the pay phone. She considers her reflectio in the chrome around the keypad. She dials. INT. MAMA MABELLE’S DINER - DAY
You had us stash a kidnapped drug lord in the garage of your ex- girlfriend? That is messed up.
She was never my girlfriend.
Did you two... Bobby’s non-answer gives Stig his answer.
Like I said, “Messed up.” Mama Maybelle thrusts a breakfast plate at Bobby.
Over easy with a side of pancakes.  9/15/09 2guns 79.
You tell her how I feel about pancakes?
He told me but it’s my place and in my place everyone eats a good breakfast. How can Bobby say no? Maybelle pats Bobby’s head and retu to the kitchen. Bobby considers Stig, decides be square.

You and I aren’t in this together, are we?
No.
You're just doing what you gotta do, right? The rest is just stuff that makes you stupid.  9/15/09 2guns 80. Swallowing his hurt, Stig returns to the flattop.
Order up. Bobby feels like a heel. Glancing around the restaurant h notes that the place is dead empty.

Looks like we flushed a couple of rabbits. Papi clubs Bobby with his shotgun. Bobby goes down. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) Take ‘em and skin him.
80 million dollars. (Papi stops.) 81.53 actually. It’s what we stole from the CIA. We lied and said two but it’s really 81.53. Million.
81.53 million?
Yours for the taking.
Where is it?
I don’t know. But he does. He took it and hid it somewhere.
No, I didn’t.
Sure, you did.
What are you talking about?
Shut up and agree with me before they decide to kill you and keep me alive.
I hid the money.
Actually, I’m the one who hid it.
You just said I hid it.  9/15/09 2guns 82.
Well, one of us did. Papi considers Bobby. Then Stig. Then 81.53 million dollars. Papi clubs Stig. Stig joins Bobby on the ground.
Take them both.

Greco's boys frog-march Bobby and Stig around the diner. Bobby spots Deb hiding across the street. He waves her of with a shake of his head. Deb nods and scuttles away. Bob and Stig are thrown in a car trunk. The lid slams. BLACK.

You knew where the money was.

Like you've always told me everything? I could’ve let Papi Greco chop you into little pieces. But I didn’t. If that’s not enough of a good faith gesture I don’t know what is. Bobby scoffs. The doors suddenly SLAM open. Papi’s boys storm in...  9/15/09 2guns 89.

Bobby and Stig jounce along in the bed of a rusty pickup, hoods over their heads. The pickup stops. Bobby and Stig are hoisted out, their hoods removed. They are in the middle of a BARREN MEXICAN NOWHERE. Hands march Bobby and Stig over to a panel truck. Inside 20 Mexicans clutch bundles and backpacks.
The truck will take you near the border. From there you go on foot with the coyotes.
If it’s all the same, we’d rather drive.

With everybody looking for you, you'd get pulled out of line at the border in two seconds. No, you go over like you force my people. Papi’s men hoist Bobby and Stig up into the truck. PAPI. GRECO (CONT’D) I’m trusting you as men to fulfill your side of the bargain.

Scout’s honor. Papi WHISTLES. The side door of a van whips open. Inside Ferret-Nose Julio shines a light on the face of a cuffed gagged woman. If'’S DEB. Her eyes scream to Bobby as -- -- the truck’s roll door slams down. INT. CARGO BAY, PANEL TRUCK —- CONTINUOUS Bobby tries to wrench the door back up but it won't budge O.S. we hear the CLICK-CLACK of the door being padlocked the RUMBLE of the engine as the truck sloshes off on its
Help me, goddamn it.
There’s nothing to do.  9/15/09 2guns 90.
He’s got Deb.
I saw. Stig finds a comfortable spot among the other travellers.
Papi’s not gonna hurt her. She’s his insurance we come back with the money and not a squadron of helicopter gunships.
When they drop us at the border, we'll double back.
If we double back, he’ll put a bullet in her just for spite. Bobby knows Stig’s right. He kicks the wall of the truck.
We go ahead with the plan, get the money from the Admiral, then at least we have some leverage.
A plan? You mean there’s an actual plan in your head for invading a high security naval base?
I'm working on it. Stig tilts his head back, closes his eyes.

The truck bounces and sways. In the half light, Bobby considers the other passengers. A few know each other, bu for the most part they keep to themselves. Bobby sees the fear, their hope, their leap of faith determination. Beside Bobby, Stig starts to snore. Bobby pokes him.
You're snoring.  9/15/09 2guns 91.
And?
Leave it to you to sleep.
I was tired. Stig pulls himself upright. Looks at Bobby.
You in love with her?
Deb? I don’t know. Haven't really been in a position to answer the question.

‘Cuz you kinda act like you’re in love with her. Bobby chews on that for a beat. STIG (CONT’D) You really wanna know why I can sleep? Because I know what I’m fighting for. You, you don’t even know how you got here.
I’m here because you set me up.

The Admiral taught me duty, honor, loyalty to the chain of command. He may be a two-faced S.0O.B. but the values weren’t wrong. I went into that bank because I believed we had a debt to the men we'd left behind. And when we get to Corpus I’m going to kill the Admiral because he violated the trust that comes with oak leaves on your cap.
You’re an idiot.  9/15/09 2guns 92.

Of course I’m an idiot. To believe in anything you have to forget that for 50,000 years human beings have been chopping each other’s heads off and shoving each other into ovens. We’re not nice creatures. But at least I sleep at night. Stig tilts his head back, shuts his eyes.
You wanna know why I went into that bank? It was the only way to get Papi Greco. And I was going to do whatever it took.

Whatever it takes is a dangerous thing, Bobby. The Admiral’s just doing whatever it takes. So are your buddys at the CIA. Me, I'd rather be an idiot. Stig shuts his eyes leaving Bobby to ponder this. Brakes SQUEAK as the truck jerks to a halt. The roll door opens.
Four COYOTES (bandanas over their faces, shotguns on thei arms) herd Bobby, Stig, and the others out of the truck a march them off into the desert night.

Bobby and Stig follow the others through the inky night. ground is ragged. Stumbles are frequent, but no one complains. No one helps anyone else up either. The coyotes prod one of the laggards on at gun point. Sti takes offense and interposes himself between the laggard the coyote. The dead-eyed coyote puts his muzzle to Stig’ chest. Bobby takes Stig by the arm.
Not our fight. Stig isn’t happy about it but he backs off and tromps onw  9/15/09 2guns 93.
The coyotes lead the pack to a bluff overlooking the Rio Grande. The lead coyote points down to a narrow spit wher they should ford.

Bobby and Stig follow the others down to the riverside. Wordlessly the immigrants remove their shoes and carry th up over their heads as they enter the water. Stig and Bobby wade in with the others. The water quickly rises to chest height. The swirling current threatens to knock them off their feet. One of the immigrant men slips, then surfaces with a spla of flailing limbs. He can’t swim. The other immigrants hustle out of the river and up the b afraid the drowning man’s noise will get them all caught. Bobby tosses his shoes at Stig and dives after the drowni man. The man grabs at Bobby’s face. Bobby bats away the panicked man’s arms and takes him around the neck.
Callate. Tranquilo. The man calms. Bobby hauls the man over to where he can stand. The man scampers up the bank and disappears. Bobby sloshes ashore. Stig tosses Bobby his shoes.
Not our fight?
At least he stopped to say thank you.
Because that’s why you did it? For the thank you?
When this is over I’m still gonna shoot you.

Whatever you say, Bobby.  9/15/09 2guns 94, Stig pats Bobby on the shoulder and heads up the bank. Bo finishes tying his shoes and follows. Trudging onward, they make their way toward the putrid so light glow smudged across the horizon.

Bobby and Stig emerge into a vast mall parking lot filled with oblivious consumers lugging bags of extraneous, overpriced crap. After the coyotes and the desert and the river, the culture shock is a bit of a mind bender.
(re: the sea of cars) Got a favorite color?
Bobby and Stig drive East in a stolen blue minivan.

Bobby wakes. He is alone in the van. He climbs out. Across the way Bobby spots Stig at a picnic table in deep conversation with Mama Maybelle. Stig and Maybelle hug. Stig returns carrying a hefty duffle bag.
What was that about?
I figure she should know how her son died.
Isn’t that a violation of government secrecy?
Arrest me. Stig hoists the duffle into the minivan, zips it open. Th bag is crammed with pistols, rifles, etc.
My rainy day stash. Stig digs out a pack of military I.D. cards. Selects two.  9/15/09 2guns 95.

location: FRONT GATE, CORPUS CHRISTI NAVAL AIR STATION

text: Heavily fortified. Stig and Bobby roll up.
My people. I do the talking.
What’s the plan?
I’m working on it. Stig holds the I.D. cards out to the SHORE PATROL GATE GU
What’s your name, Seaman?
Excuse me?
This is an improptu security inspection under D.O.D. order 27592, so give me your name before I decide I’m having a bad day.
Seaman Weisberg, sir.
Write that down.
No disrespect, Commander, but all uncleared visitors have to be phoned into the security office.

What part of “impromptu” do you not register, Seaman? It means you don’t tell anyone you’re coming. Did you graduate high school, I know they make you graduate high school, so you had options. You didn’t have to burden my Navy with your stupidity. You chose to burden my Navy with your stupidity. (MORE )

Now wave us through and don’t even to think about FUBARing my inspection by alerting the world we're here to check the security status of this base. The SP motions to lift the gate and waves them though.
That was your brilliant plan?
I can’t believe it worked. Bobby checks his side mirror. In the reflection he sees t SP picking up the phone.
I wouldn’t get too healthy congratulating yourself. The guard’s in the shack on the phone.
No worries. It’1ll take at least 3 minutes to scramble the Shore Patrol so we’ve got that for a head start.

You are just a big ball of sunshine. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS, CORPUS CHRISTI N.A.S. -— DAY A small but pleasant house on base. The Admiral takes the million out of his safe and splits it between three suitcases. Quince enters.
It’s time, Admiral.
Thank you, Chief. If you’ll finish splitting the money between the bags. We'll cache the first in Panama, the second in Dubai, the third in Hong Kong.
Flight plan’s all arranged.  9/15/09 2guns 97. The Admiral gives Quince a “well done” pat and crosses in the LIVING ROOM where Teemo, pale and feverish, is laid o on the sofa.
I hate to see you like this, son. An officer takes on a mission, he has to constantly balance the desire to protect his men versus the need to complete the mission.
Yes, sir.

For two days, I’ve been forced to let you suffer. And you have been magnificent. Because you understand the mission is greater than any one of us. If I could show you my heart, it aches. The Admiral stands. Levels a pistol at Teemo.
Sir?

I take no pleasure in this. BLAM. EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS, CORPUS CHRISTI N.A.S. - DAY SCREECH - Tires smoke as the minivan jerks to a halt outs the Admiral’s quarters. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS, CORPUS CHRISTI N.A.S. - DAY Stig and Bobby burst in the back door, guns at the ready. alternating turns they move forward through the house. On the sofa they find Teemo’s dead body.

He’s dead. Bobby crosses into the study and rifles the Admiral’s des Stig lingers reverently over the body. In a drawer, Bobby finds a bill from the CAMINO REAL HOTE A connection sparks...  9/15/09 2guns 98.
When you delivered the money to the Admiral in El Paso what hotel was he staying at?
The Camino Real. The information hits Bobby like a shovel.
Sonofa... Come on. I know where to intercept the Admiral.
(still considering Teemo) I only shot him in the leg.
Well, somebody else must have shot him in the chest. Bobby looks at Stig. Stig looks at Bobby. A mutual realization hits.
Come outside with your hands raised. We have the house surrounded. Bobby and Stig rush to the windows. Outside the house is surrounded by four dozen armed SPs and a dozen vehicles.
Terrific plan you had.
I didn’t figure we’d need an exit strategy. (re: Teemo) You think they’1l think we killed him?
No, they’re gonna think we broke onto the base to give him an appendectomy.
There you go with the defensive sarcasm. All right, look, these are innocent sailors. I don’t want any of them getting shot.  9/15/09 2guns 99.
And I’m sure their orders are to just put a few warning shots in the backs of our heads.
I mean it. I want your word.
Fine.
Good. So what do we do now?
(thinks) Do you trust me?
Do you trust me?
Not the question.
Yes. I do.
Then go outside and surrender. Bobby blows past Stig.

What? Bobby? EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME SPs with itchy trigger fingers surround the house... INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Bobby cranks the bathroom tub on full bore. Then heads fo THE KITCHEN - Bobby pulls the stove out from the wall. Knifes the gas line. Then grabs a trash bag and goes into THE ADMIRAL’S BEDROOM - Bobby swipes a clean uniform. Stu it in the trash bag.  9/15/09 2guns 100. EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The front door cracks. Stig slides outside, hands raised. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Bobby tosses a bar tray on the kitchen floor. Smashes the neck off a whiskey bottle. Dumps it over the tray... EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Stig eases away from the house...

.»..On your knees... Hands where I can see ‘em... Give me an excuse... Stig sinks to his knees... INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Bobby ties off the trash bag, tosses it in the now full t Takes a deep breath and... Bobby fires at the metal bar tray... The tray sparks. The booze catches fire... Bobby dives for the tub as... The leaking gas ignites. A FIREBALL shoots through the house... Bobby dives underwater as above him flames fill bathroom... EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The gas explosion blows out every window in the house. St is knocked flat. Splintered wood and glass fly. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The fireball retreats from the bathroom. Bobby pops up ou of the water with a gasp.  9/15/09 2guns 101. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - 15 MINUTES LATER Firemen storm the house with hoses and axes. There are sm and flames throughout the house, but the bulk of the fire contained in the kitchen. Amid the chaos, Bobby, slips ou of the bathroom, dressed in the stolen uniform.
Push those flames back.

(reacting to the uniform) It’s not safe yet, sir. You really need to stay outside. EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The SPs have Stig stuffed in a patrol car. In the B.G. we see Bobby exit the house and slip away amid the commotion
Bobby drives through the lonely desperate landscape. Foot the floor. Eyes locked straight ahead.
Bobby stands at a pay phone. He considers the sharpie scr on his arm. In his hand is Earl’s card.
Give me the office of the D.D.O.... It’s about 81.53 million dollars.
An AGITATED LIEUTENANT leans in tight over Stig.

Silence is not your friend. You murdered a decorated Navy SEAL. Stig stares straight ahead. AGITATED LIEUTENANT (CONT’D) You've betrayed everything the service stands for.  9/15/09 2guns 102. Stig remains stone. The frustrated Lieutenant whips a cof mug past Stig’s ear. The mug shatters.
That’s a waste of a good mug, sir. The door cracks as the Lieutenant is called out of the ro Two beats later he returns.
Get out of here. You’re free to go. Stig suspects a trick. He rises. He walks out. No one tries to stop him.
Stig steps outside. Waiting there are Earl, Thick, and Le
Get in the car. (when Stig hesitates) It’s not multiple choice, son.
A squat turbo prop. The Admiral rests his elbow on the ca filled suitcases. Along the cargo bay wall sit Quince, Mi and the other SEALs (Lucas, Kelvin, Sanger, and Gomez).
Make the Navy proud, boys. As one the SEALs rise and sprint out the back of the plan REVEAL - The plane is flying at 10,000 feet.

Down down down the SEALs plunge. Until finally at an impossibly low altitude - POP - they deploy chutes. INT. LIVING ROOM, GRECO’S RANCH - NIGHT Papi circles around Deb. Deb holds her expression blank.  9/15/09 2guns 103.
Your Bobby’s a determined fellow. I don’t care what his badge says, he was Bobby Beans. And robbing the Tres Cruces only proves it.
Maybe he just has his own view of the law.
You don’t have to defend him. Papi reaches into a safe, counts out $400,000. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) You sure you wouldn’t rather take a percentage of the money he and Stig bring back?
I don’t work on contingency. Papi smirks. Hands her the money. Pours them each a drink
When you told me Bobby was DEA, did you know he’d rob the Tres Cruces?
Nope.
Just lucky I guess? Papi smiles. Deb smiles back. Neither smile quite genuine

THREE OF PAPI’S GUARDS patrol. 0O.S. They hear an approac engine. WHOOSH - The unlit C-2A skims just over their hea and touches down. The guards snap alert. The lead guard chatters into his radio. Several more guards arrive and surround the plane. The plane taxis to a stop and lowers its tailgate. The guards finger their triggers. Inside the plane a SPOTLIGH snaps on. On cue --  9/15/09 2guns 104. Bullets ZIP-ZIP-ZIP into the guards from all directions. Those who aren’t killed outright spray haphazard volleys the darkness until - ZIP-ZIP - they too are cut down. The Admiral steps off the plane. Quince and the other SEA who parachuted from the plane rise up from their hidden f spots around the airfield.
Scorched Earth, Chief. Nothing lives.
Oscar (the guy who had the head in the bag) marches up to of Papi’s TOUGHS. 0.S. Sporadic GUNFIRE rips.

Grab some men, head for the airfield. The toughs scurry off. Emerging from the shadows Bobby sneaks up behind Oscar. Oscar spins. Bobby kicks him in t balls. Smacks him with the butt of his pistol. Oscar’s no shatters. He drops.
Bobby slips down the stairs into the network of tunnels t run beneath the ranch.

Jittery vaqueros pan their rifles as predatory shadows su and dart towards them. Closer. Closer. The vaqueros start popping off bursts of fire. SEAL hands snatch the vaqueros from behind and slash their throats. INT. LIVING ROOM, GRECO’S RANCH - NIGHT Papi peers out the window and the black night. 0.S. Rippl of intermittent gunfire draw closer. Papi glances over at Deb who is recounting the $400k.
You know, I don’t usually do business with women.  9/15/09 2guns 105.
That’s short sighted and sexist of you.
With a man, you know why he does what he does. With a woman, who knows? Crossing to a filigreed chest Papi pulls out a shotgun. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) Who’s out there?
How would I know? According to you I’m just supposed to sit here and look cute.
Sweeping across the ranch, the SEALS FIREBOMB the drug processing barns. EXPLOSIONS rock the night.
Bobby scurries along. Up ahead armed toughs herd a clutch cocaine workers along at gun point. Bobby dives into a si passage and lets them pass.
Bobby slips up into the main house through a hidden door. INT. LIVING ROOM, GRECO’S RANCH - SAME Papi jabs the shotgun at Deb. Deb calmly stows the $400k her jacket. O.S. more EXPLOSIONS boom.
Tell me who they are? CIA? DEA? Appearing in the doorway --

U.S. Navy. You got in bed with the wrong girl.  9/15/09 2guns 106. As Papi whirls to level the shotgun at Bobby, Deb pulls a from her belt and just like that everyone starts blasting Bullets rip the air. Furniture shreds. Papi is hit in the gut. Deb flees. Bobby chases.
Deb sprints down a long corridor. Bobby fires two shots p her ear. Dead to rites, she freezes.
You should’ve told me Harvey was an Admiral. This all would’ve been so much easier to figure out. (beat) You're the one person I trusted.
You never trusted me or anyone. And don’t say you meant to. You were always all about you. Bobby is stung. Because it’s the truth.
You're right. I was a sonofabitch. Now let’s go. Bobby snatches away Deb’s .22 and drags her onward.
The roughnecks guarding the house spray wild gunfire as t murderously efficient SEALs - ZIP-ZIP-ZIP - wipe them out
Bobby hauls Deb toward the back door. A stray volley SHATTERS the windows. Bobby yanks Deb to the floor.
You’ve got no chance, you know that?
Shh. Wait for it. O.S. The faint WHUP-WHUP of a helicopter. Bobby grins.  9/15/09 2guns 107.
(calling outside) Hey, Harvey, you out there?
Mr. Bobby Trench. You are a resilient fly in the ointment.
I've got Deb in here, Harvey, and since you two are in love, I thought you might be willing to trade her for the money.
No. No deals.

Well, before your boys start blasting, you might want to take a look off to the East. On the horizon, two lights approach low and fast. Twin bl helicopters armed with mean-ass 20mm gun cannons. The lead helo swoops down and alights while the second he circles protectively. Earl and his boys climb out draggin Stig with them.

Hail, hail, the gang’s all here. Mexican standoff time. Literally. The SEALs have their guns on the CIA. The CIA have their guns on the SEALs. Both side have their guns on Bobby as ushers Deb outside. Cautiously, The Admiral, Bobby, and Earl approach each ot Bobby towing Deb, Earl towing Stig.
What’s the deal here, Bob? You promised me 81 million dollars in return for getting this pudknocker out of stir.  9/15/09 2guns 108.
I thought the Admiral might trade Deb for the money, but it turns out he’s not the romantic type, so I guess you two are gonna have to duke it out.

Is that right? A beat. All sides on edge. Who will make the first move? Out of nowhere - BA-BLAM - a shotgun blast rips into Earl arm. It’s PAPI GRECO. Bleeding from the gut, the drug lor lurches out of the house, shotgun blazing. Bobby tosses Stig a pistol as all sides open fire. It’s a free-for-all of dust and lead. Bullets fly. Bodies sprawl Two SEALs drop (Sanger & Kelvin). Bobby and Stig dash for the cover of a nearby barn while SEALs retreat toward the livestock pens and the helo rain down fire from above.
Chased by strafing helo fire, Bobby and Stig dive inside.
Not to crack on your strategy, but this was the best you could come up with?
You’d rather be back in the brig? Bobby kicks the straw off a trapdoor. Beneath it is a lad leading to the tunnels. Ignoring Bobby, Stig takes a rifl off the body of one of Papi’s men.
Come on, the tunnels lead all the way to the edge of the ranch.
And then what?
And then we get the hell out of here before the Navy or the CIA or both of them shoot the hell out of us.  9/15/09 2guns 109.
No. I’m not letting the Admiral get away with the money.
Jesus-goddamn... I just saved your ass.
So go. Get out of here. Go tell the world Deb set you up and clear your name. It’s not like we’re in this together. Bobby curses. He kicks wall. He stays.
Where you go, I go. (beat) You’re my people.
(touched) For real?
Can we just do this? Stig tosses Bobby an extra clip. Flanking the door, they peek out for the circling helicopters --
I hate Mexico.
I’m sure it hates you back. -- and race off in pursuit of the Admiral.
Cradling his shattered arm, Earl crosses to Papi, who lay dying in the dust.
Why’d you lie to me? We were just doing business.
Mow... my... lawn.  9/15/09 2guns 110. Papi manages a blood choked gurgle/giggle. Earl raises hi pistol and shoots Papi dead.

Bobby and Stig engage the SEALs in a running fire-fight through the narrow alleys between pens. The spooked cattle buck, they bellow, they crash through fencing and STAMPEDE. Amid the swirl of 2000 pound beasts, Bobby and Stig get separated. Stig is knocked to the dirt. Quince steps out and has the drop on Stig when... A bullet rips through Quince’s neck. Quince falls reveali Thick as the shooter.
Thanks. Without hesitation or remorse Thick pivots his gun on Sti ...-Before Thick can fire, Bobby dives into view and fire the CIA man forcing him to retreat back out of sight.
We having fun yet?

The C-2A pilot fires up his engines as the Admiral and th remaining SEALs descend on the airfield. From above the CIA helo strafes the cockpit killing the pilot. As the pilot falls forward, he jams the right engi throttle causing the plane to taxi in a circle and crash a metal shed. The propellers shred. Bits of tin spray.

Amid the flames of the drug processing barns, Bobby and S trade heavy fire with Thick and Lean. From above the helo strafes. Bullets swiss-cheese the tin roof. Bobby and Stig go sprawling. Bobby spots a huge BULLDOZER. He taps Stig.

9/15/09 2guns 111. ABOVE THE BARN - the circling helo pilot spots a puff of diesel smoke as Bobby and Stig come CRASHING through the of the barn on the bulldozer. The helo swoops. Bobby raises the front bucket as a shiel The helo’s bullets PING. Stig pours fire up at the helo’s tail rotor. The rotor sparks, smokes. The helo goes into a flat spin and CRASHE

The SEALs retrieve the cash-filled suitcases from the crippled plane and toss them in an SUV when -- -- Bobby and Stig come barreling over the rise on the bulldozer. Gomez and Lucas hose down the dozer, while the Admiral, Deb, and Mini pile in the SUV. Flooring the throttle Bobby runs right over the two SEALs not before Lucas rolls a GRENADE beneath the treads. Stig and Bobby leap from the bulldozer as - BOOM - the grenade explosion FLIPS THE BULLDOZER onto its side. Bobby and Stig haul themselves up. In the distance the SU speeds off in a cloud of dust. Bobby and Stig look at each other. Look at the ratty CESS parked along the runway.
Bobby and Stig take off in the Cessna.

The SUV rips across the vast desert nothing, trailing a 5 yard plume of dust. Above, Stig throttles up the Cessna and dives. Swooping d he thumps the Cessna’s landing gear on the roof of the SU Deb jerks the wheel and speeds off in a different directi Stig loops around and dives again. This time Mini and the Admiral pour fire out the windows at the plane. Bullets r the cabin. Stig is forced to pull up.
We could pull back and track them.  9/15/09 2guns 112. Bobby taps blinking “LOW FUEL” light.
We don’t have the gas.
That settles it then.
Yup. Stig banks the plane around and dives so that the plane i a direct head-on collision course with the SUV.
They’re coming right at us.
They’11 pull up. IN THE PLANE -— Stig drops the Cessna so that its wheels scrape the groun
You sure you don’t want me to pull up?
Absolutely.

Cool. Plane and SUV hurtle at each other. 50 yards... 25... 10. Deb jerks the wheel. The SUV fishtails. The Cessna T-bone the SUV. The SUV barrel rolls. The plane goes ass-over- teakettle. Then silence. The SUV lays on its side, tires still spinning. The plane sits inverted on its back. INSIDE THE PLANE - Bobby and Stig hang upsidedown. Bobby claws at his belt release. Drops with a groan-inducing th
(groggy) Well, that was a hoot.
You all right?  9/15/09 2guns 113.
Busted rib, maybe. Stig pulls at his belts. Jammed. Bobby looks over at the overturned SUV. The fate of its passengers undetermined.

Go on. I’m cool. Bobby shimmies out of the plane. Gun drawn, he side steps toward the SUV. The SUV’s engine hisses... The tires spin Bobby swings around the nose and levels his pistol throug the fractured windshield at... Mini’s dead body. A pistol jabs against the back of Bobby’s neck. It’s the Admiral, his face bloody, his right leg dragging awkwardl
Stig?
Drop the pistol.

Stig, I kinda need your help here. Stig, who has dragged himself free of the plane, sees the Admiral with a gun to Bobby’s neck and snap draws his own The Admiral pulls Bobby tight in front of him as a shield
Don't do it, sailor.
Do it. Shoot him. Stig considers the narrow angle he has on the Admiral.
I don’t know. It’s tight.
You won't miss.
I could miss. Rising up from a ditch, Deb levels her gun at Stig.  9/15/09 2guns 114.
Drop the gun. Aw, crap.
I’1l1 shoot you where you Take the shot. stand.
She said to lay down the She’s kinda got a gun pointed weapon. at me.
Fine. I got yours. You got mine.
If you miss and I get shot...
I’m gonna count to three. One. BLAM-BLAM - Stig and Bobby both fire. Bobby hits Deb in t chest. Stig puts his through the Admiral’s eye. Bobby crosses to Deb who is rapidly bleeding out.
Say something nice.
You always had a beautiful neck. Deb dies. Nearby Stig stands over the Admiral’s body. Bobby joins h
Think they’11 give him a full honor guard?
Of course they will. There’s no way they'll admit the truth.
Well, that sucks. The remaining CIA helo, its gun cannon locked on, glides of the dawn and alights. Earl and the boys climb out. Ear motions to retrieve the money from the overturned SUV.
You won't mind if we take back what was ours all along.  9/15/09 2guns 115.
Would it matter if we did?
(aside to Earl) You're just gonna let them go?
We have the money. The people who conspired to steal it are dead. We've got no further business with these gentlemen.
What about the warrants for our arrest?
A misunderstanding.
Both our names are clear?
I trust you’ll find your own way home? With that Earl climbs back into the helicopter and flies
What now? Bobby cross to Deb's body. Takes the 400k out of her jack Tosses it to Stig.
For Mama Maybelle.
Thanks.
There is one more thing. Bobby gives Stig a look.
Aw, you're not serious?
Leg or arm?  9/15/09 2guns 116.
You're really gonna do this?
Looks like we’re gonna have to walk out of here, so I’m thinking arm.
You are a petty, vindictive sonofa-- Bobby shoots Stig in the arm.
Ow! Motherless-goat-sucking...

Hurts, don’t it? INT. MAMA MABELLE’S DINER - DAY Mama opens a brown wrapped packet. Inside is the $400k an photo of her son in his dress uniform. On the back of the photo is a note: “A pitiful token in honor of your loss.” On Maybelle. Moved.

location: BANK VAULT, 1ST STATE BANK OF CENTERVILLE

text: A long line of cash crammed safe deposit boxes. How much cash? Say 81.53 million? Earl flips the boxes shut. Slide them into their wall slots. Locks the doors.
Centerville, Iowa is a placid mid-western small town. Exiting the bank Earl gets in a car with Mr. Lean. ACROSS THE TOWN SQUARE - at a window table in the CENTERV DINER are Bobby and Stig.
Stig, his arm in a sling, scans the menu as Bobby watches Earl drive off.
I saw some nice looking blueberry pancakes go by.  9/15/09 2guns 117.
When have I ever ordered pancakes?
There’s always hope. The waitress, MARGIE, approaches.
What can I get you, boys?
Well, Margie, I was looking over the menu here--
(cutting to the point) How are your jelly donuts?
To tell the truth, our donuts are kinda lousy.
I can’t tell you how happy we are to hear that.
